meanings.definition: Test (something) beforehand to determine its effectiveness or suitability.
meanings.sent1: Before the big race, the coach decided to pretest the new running shoes.
meanings.sent2: It is important to pretest the microphone before the event to avoid technical issues.
meanings.sent3: The scientist pretested the new invention and accidentally made it explode in the lab!
meanings.sent4: She pretested her negotiation skills in a mock scenario before the real meeting.
meanings.sent5: The teacher pretested the students' knowledge to tailor the lesson accordingly.

meanings.definition: The act of testing something beforehand.
meanings.sent1: The pretesting of the new software revealed several bugs that needed fixing.
meanings.sent2: Before the launch, the team conducted thorough pretesting to ensure a smooth release.
meanings.sent3: The pretesting of the roller coaster left the engineers feeling confident about its safety.
meanings.sent4: The pretesting of the emergency procedures proved to be crucial during the drill.
meanings.sent5: The pretesting of the recipe helped avoid any cooking disasters during the event.
